articles.title: Sex is getting scrubbed from the internet, but a billionaire can sell you AI nudes

articles.title: Robustness Distributions in Neural Network Verification
articles.description: Neural networks are vulnerable to slight alterations to otherwise correctly classified inputs, leading to incorrect predictions. To rigorously assess the robustness of neural networks against such perturbations, verification techniques can be employed. Robustness is generally measured in terms of adversarial accuracy, based on an upper bound on the magnitude of perturbations commonly denoted by ε. For each input in a given set, a verifier determines whether a perturbation up to magnitude ε can...
articles.author: Annelot Bosman, Aaron Berger, Holger H. Hoos, Jan N. van Rijn
articles.content: Neural networks are vulnerable to slight alterations to otherwise correctly classified inputs, leading to incorrect predictions. To rigorously assess the robustness of neural networks against such perturbations, verification techniques can be employed. Robustness is generally measured in terms of adversarial accuracy, based on an upper bound on the magnitude of perturbations commonly denoted by ε. For each input in a given set, a verifier determines whether a perturbation up to magnitude ε can...

articles.title: Stem cell startup proclaims ‘inflection point’ for medicine as mass production nears
articles.description: It’s harvest day at the Karolinska Institute in Stockholm. As sunshine bathes the leafy university campus, scientists inside the labs work under cool fluorescent light. Clad in green protective gear, they tend meticulously to test tubes within hermetically sealed cleanrooms. The containers hold the fruits of today’s labour: mesenchymal stem cells (MSCs). Each cell is barely a quarter the width of a human hair but wields remarkable power. MSCs reduce inflammation, repair damaged tissue, and...
articles.author: Thomas Macaulay

articles.title: Learning How to Vote with Principles: Axiomatic Insights Into the Collective Decisions of Neural Networks
articles.description: Can neural networks be applied in voting theory, while satisfying the need for transparency in collective decisions? We propose axiomatic deep voting: a framework to build and evaluate neural networks that aggregate preferences, using the well-established axiomatic method of voting theory. Our findings are: (1) Neural networks, despite being highly accurate, often fail to align with the core axioms of voting rules, revealing a disconnect between mimicking outcomes and reasoning. (2) Training...
articles.author: Levin Hornischer, Zoi Terzopoulou

articles.title: Argumentative Reasoning in ASPIC+ under Incomplete Information
articles.description: Reasoning under incomplete information is an important research direction in the study of computational argumentation. Most advances in this direction so far have focused on abstract argumentation frameworks. In particular, development of computational approaches to reasoning under incomplete information in structured formalisms remains to a large extent a challenge. We address this challenge by studying the problems of determining stability and relevance—with the aim of analyzing aspects of...
articles.author: Daphne Odekerken, Tuomo Lehtonen, Johannes P. Wallner, Matti Järvisalo
